events.title: Execution of William Wallace
events.description: William Wallace, a Scottish knight and a leader during the Wars of Scottish Independence, was executed by the English in London.
events.significance: Wallace became a symbol of Scottish resistance and patriotism.

events.title: Sacco and Vanzetti Executed
events.description: Nicola Sacco and Bartolomeo Vanzetti, Italian-American anarchists, were executed in Massachusetts after a controversial trial for robbery and murder.
events.significance: Their trial and execution sparked international debates on justice and political persecution.

events.title: Battle of Stalingrad Begins
events.description: The German Sixth Army launched an offensive to capture the city of Stalingrad (now Volgograd) in the Soviet Union during World War II.
events.significance: Marked one of the bloodiest battles in history; its outcome was a turning point in WWII favoring the Allies.

events.title: Soviet Troops Crackdown on Baltic Independence Movements
events.description: In Vilnius, Lithuania, Soviet forces attacked peaceful protesters demanding independence, leading to deaths and increased international attention.
events.significance: This event galvanized the Baltic independence movements and highlighted the weakening Soviet grip.
